characters: KLINGON BLOOD FLOATS IN THE AIR
TIGHT ON KIRK'S EYES. JUMP BACK TO REVEAL
THRU WARDROOMS, LAUNDRY, SICKBAY, JEFFERIES TUBE, CUPBO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The polyglot CREW is busy. Seated in the CAPTAIN'S CHAIR, a familiar face: SULU. He has his own command and is drinking a CUP of tea. The SCIENCE OFFICER stands next to him, conferring, handing him a datacount. Sulu muses over the contents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to this we've completed our exploration of the entire sector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty-four planets - and their gaseous atmospheric anomalies. Our sensing and analytic equipment worked well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then it's time we were heading home. Three years is... The ship starts to TREMBLE.

dialogues.speaker: SULU'S TEA CUP
dialogues.text: shaking in its saucer... Sulu and the CREW look at each other as the SHAKING increases. The TEACUP SMASHES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have an energy wave from 240 degrees mark six port --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Visual!

dialogues.speaker: VFX
dialogues.text: an ENORMOUS GASEOUS WAVE, a subspace shock front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) My God. SHIELDS.

dialogues.speaker: VFX
dialogues.text: Meteors and asteroids SMASHING PAST. Burning chunks fly by at WARP speeds. EXCELSIOR reels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ship rolls, throwing everyone off balance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the Hell is going on? The crew jumps to. Computers light up. Information flies across screens and monitors. The ship is BATTERED like a fighter's punching bag with shocks and jolts and tremors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleeping members are thrown from their berths. The CLAXON alarm sounds pervasively... What the -- Look out -- stations -- etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, she's not answering her helm --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starboard thrusters. Turn her into the wave!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaos. Valves hiss PURPLE. Crew running, knocked about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Engine room. What's going on up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quarter impulse power! EXCELSIOR has been knocked about and everyone on the bridge is holding on or sliding around. She settles and one by one her CREW resume their stations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damage report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems to be in one piece, Captain. We're checking all systems...

dialogues.speaker: VFXA
dialogues.text: shows Excelsior getting bumped about by the final fragments drifting past, bouncing off the shields.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Science Officer) Don't tell me that was any meteor shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over his console) Negative. The subspace shockwave originated at bearing three-two- three, mark seven-five, the location is... (turns to Sulu) Praxis. A Klingon moon. Barren of indigenous life forms but -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Essential as a resource. Praxis is their key energy production facility. (thinks) Send to Klingon High Command: "This is Excelsior, a Federation Starship traveling through Beta Quadrant. We have monitored a  large explosion in your sector. Do you require assistance?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Valtane, any more data?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have confirmed the location, sir, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I cannot confirm the existence of Praxis. Sulu reacts, goes over to the science console and looks at the screen. Nothing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Praxis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's left of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, I'm getting a message from Klingon High Command.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Onscreen.

dialogues.speaker: ON SCREEN
dialogues.text: a snowy picture of a WILD-EYED KLINGON OFFICER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is an emergency! We have suffered - He looks around, the GROUND is shaking under him; as Sulu watches, the pictures collapse, then comes on again, with a different face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Brigadier Kerla, speaking for the High Command. There has been an incident on Praxis. However everything is under control. We have no need for assistance. Obey treaty stipulations and remain outside the Neutral Zone. Transmission ends now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 12   The screen goes black. Sulu looks incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An INCIDENT?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do we report this, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? (swivels to the communications officer) Send to Starfleet Command...

dialogues.speaker: VFX
dialogues.text: Excelsior warps off into the galaxy.

dialogues.speaker: 22A CU STARFLEET SHIELD
dialogues.text: Kirk walks into shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we doing here? WIDEN TO REVEAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room fills with BEMEDALED BRASS, Kirk's CREW among them - the only starship complement in the room. They can't help looking at each other, questioning. They are in uniforms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Search me. Anybody know how come we made the A list?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My shore leave was just cancelled. (reacting) Isn't this just for top brass?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is Mr. Sulu?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Sulu... on assignment... anyone seen Spock? A door opens and STARFLEET ADMIRAL DONALD, austere and impressive, enters and gavels the meeting to order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This briefing is classified. There will be no recording devices. Ladies and Gentlemen, the C-in-C. All rise as the STARFLEET COMMANDER IN CHIEF enters with a briefcase and pulls materials from it. As you were. I'll make this as simple as I possibly can. The Klingon empire has roughly 50  years of life left to it. They look at each other in disbelief. (continuing) For full details, I am turning this briefing over to our Special Federation Envoy. He makes a sign and another door opens. Spock walks to the podium. Kirk and company are astounded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Two months ago a Federation Starship monitored an explosion on the Klingon moon Praxis. We believe it was caused by over mining and insufficient safety precautions. The moon's decimation means an almost eighty percent loss of available energy and a deadly pollution of their ozone. Due to their large military expenditures, the Klingon economy is in a very weakened condition. They do not have sufficient resources to manufacture air shelters in large enough quantities to sustain anything like their current population. Last month - at the behest of the, uh, Vulcan Ambassador - I opened a dialogue with Gorkon, Chancellor of the Klingon High Council. He proposes to commence negotiations at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negotiations for what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dismantling of our space stations and star bases along the Neutral Zone, an end to seventy years of unremitting hostility - a hostility the Klingons can no longer afford. Audible mutterings. PAN the crew. Is the war over?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) If the Klingons sue for peace, we could accumulate savings in defense expenditures, leaving the Federation economy free to grapple with urgent social problems...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, are we talking about mothballing the Starfleet? I'm sure our exploration and science programs would not be affected, but the facts speak for themselves, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must protest. To offer the Klingons a safe haven within Federation space is suicide. Klingons would become the alien trash of the galaxy. And if we dismantle the fleet, we'd be defenseless before a bellicose people with a foothold on our territory. The opportunity which presents itself here is to embargo trading, force them to run through their own resources faster, and bring them to their knees. Then we'll be in a far better position to dictate terms. A vocal minority of the briefing supports this, but not all. Kirk simply stares at Spock. Starfleet is under civilian control, Admiral. The decision is a political not a military one - and it's been made.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir - Captain Kirk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes Spock briefly) Sir, I'm no diplomat, but the Klingons have never been  trustworthy. I'm forced to agree with Admiral Donald. This is -  (he gropes for tact) - a terrible, a terrifying idea... Your son was killed by a Klingon, wasn't he, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. I'm sorry. But Commander Spock has persuaded the Federation that this situation is too promising to ignore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is imperative that we act NOW to support the Gorkon initiative, lest more conservative elements persuade his empire that it would be better to attempt a military solution and die fighting. Captain Kirk, you are to be our first olive branch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have volunteered to rendezvous with the Klingon ship that's bringing Chancellor Gorkon here, and escort him safely through Federation space. Kirk is too startled to speak. As it happens, Kirk, the Chancellor specifically requested you and your officers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, in God's name? There are some Klingons who feel the same about the peace treaty as yourself and Admiral Donald. They'll think twice about attacking the Enterprise under your command.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have personally vouched for you in this matter, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have personally - You will accord Chancellor Gorkon full diplomatic Courtesy, Captain Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (straining) Surely a full Ambassador would be better equipped to - If there's no further business I wish you and your crew Godspeed. Thank you all. He charges out as ALL RISE. Everyone files out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know whether to  congratulate you or not, Jim. He moves off before Kirk can reply. The room is empty... except for Spock, still at the podium and Kirk sitting alone in the auditorium. He is furious, betrayed. Spock knows it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE volunteered?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an old Vulcan proverb: only Nixon could go to China.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (incensed) How could you vouch for me? That's... (words fail him) ... arrogant presumption -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was asked by my father to open neg-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know your father's the Vulcan Ambassador for heaven's sake, but you know how I feel about this: they're animals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, there is an historic opportunity here -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock looks at him in silent reproach. Kirk hears himself and doesn't like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (and what's more) Has it occurred to you that this crew is due for retirement in three months? WE'VE DONE OUR BIT FOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock is patient. They stare at each other. ON Kirk's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally) You should have trusted me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator doors open. An attractive VULCAN LIEUTENANT leaps out of the command chair, whips to attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I've heard some whoppers in my time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlaps) They're mothballing the fleet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlaps) We will regret this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain on the bridge. The CREW stands to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you were. Lieutenant...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saavik, sir. We were told you'd need a helmsman - (to Spock) ... so I volunteered. She salutes. He smiles, returns the salute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant, I am pleased to see you. (to Kirk) The Lieutenant is the first Vulcan to be graduated at the top of her class as the Academy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Lieutenant. That must make you very proud...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe so, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a Vulcan all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (down to business) All right, let's get this over with... departure stations... (pushes the comm) Scotty? They assume their familiar stations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You find the engine room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right where I left it, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standby. Get me the dock master, Uhura.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Control tower, reading, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Control, this is Enterprise requesting permission to depart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is control. Enterprise, you are granted permission to depart... 30 seconds for port gates...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clear all moorings...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awaiting port gates from this mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mooring lines cleared...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aft thrusters -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlaps) Thank you. Lieutenant, one quarter impulse power...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she turns to face him) Captain, may I remind you that regulations specify thrusters only while in space dock? The CREW - old and young - watch this exchange keenly. Spock is poker faced

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (next to Chekov) Uh, Jim...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heard the order, Lieutenant. Saavik swivels away, rolling her eyes so Kirk can't see and hits the panel -  The ship begins to rattle slightly, then

dialogues.speaker: VFX
dialogues.text: the Enterprise SCREAMS out of the dock and exits through the just-opening bay doors into outer space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk sits comfortably with a smile on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Lieutenant... Saavik faces him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) ... I don't care if I'm senile. If I sit in this chair and give the word you jump. Spock watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plot a course for Kronos, Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled) Kronos, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm still in the chair, Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir. Other reactions. Kirk has taken command.

dialogues.speaker: VFX
dialogues.text: Enterprise cruises purposefully through the void.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain's log. Stardate 8679.225. They say you can't teach an old dog new tricks - and maybe they're right. It seems to me our mission to escort the Chancellor of the Klingon High Council to a peace summit is problematic at best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk is unpacking his bag as he dictates, hanging up his uniforms, his shaving tackle going next to the sink, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I have never trusted Klingons and never will. I have never been able to forgive them for the murder of my boy. Spock says this could be an historic moment and I'd like to believe him, but how on earth can history get past people like me? He sets up a photo of DAVID next to his berth. A delicate COUGH. Kirk realizes he's not alone. Swivels to face LIEUTENANT SAAVIK standing in the bulkhead doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Saavik, you COULD knock -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're almost at the rendezvous - I thought you'd want to know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right - He gets up and puts on his jacket. She watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Permission to speak freely, sir? He doesn't stop her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I gather you are not enthusiastic about the assignment... I don't think many on board are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You piloted well out of spacedock, Lieutenant -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost smiles) I always wanted to try that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (passing her) Only don't try putting words in my mouth. And leaves her with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saavik approaches; this time she's smart enough to KNOCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In contrast with his Spartan personality, the room is a voluptuous incense-laden lair, filled with curtains and smoke. Spock lights a votive candle; surveys her. He is out of uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have done well, Saavik. As your sponsor at the Academy I have followed your career with... satisfaction. And as a Vulcan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (intense) Sir, I speak to you as a kindred intellect. Do you not recognize that a turning point has been reached in the affairs of the Federation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not certain such speculations are included among your duties, Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klingon battlecruiser off the port bow. All hands on deck. Repeat... She's startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off her look) In time you may come to view so- called turning points with... skepticism. He starts to get into uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You must have faith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faith...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That the universe will unfold as it should.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cruise is proceeding evenly as Kirk arrives out of one turbo-lift. Spock and Lt. Saavik emerge from another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain on the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, shall we raise our shields? Spock looks at Kirk: trust me. Kirk scowls at him and stares at the screen. They all follow his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: VFX
dialogues.text: A KLINGON battlecruiser. HUGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally) Never been this close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chancellor is undoubtedly awaiting our signal. Boy is this hard for Kirk - finally:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura, hailing frequencies. Right standard rudder, bring us alongside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right standard rudder, Z plus five degrees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Channel open, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the Starship Enterprise, Captain James Kirk commanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 36   GORKON comes up on the main visual display.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is KRONOS One. I am Chancellor Gorkon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chancellor. We've been ordered to escort you through Federation space to your meeting place on Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (does his best) Uh, would you and your party care to dine this evening aboard Enterprise with my officers as guests of the United Federation of Planets?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 37   A few of the crew look around at Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd be delighted to accept your gracious invitation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nuts) We'll make arrangements to have you beamed aboard at 1930 hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shall look forward to it. He disappears. Kirk turns to Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you're happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain. He turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) - there is a supply of Romulan ale aboard - it might make the evening pass more... smoothly? Kirk smiles, relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer thinking, Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE COMMUNICATION CONSOLE
dialogues.text: Chekov leans over to Uhura.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess who is coming to dinner.

dialogues.speaker: VFX
dialogues.text: Both ships cruise parallel in space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty stands by the console. Kirk, Spock and Bones stand next to him. They are spiffed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe if their particles just got a wee bit mixed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Energize...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 40   The beams reflect on the glass shield as half dozen VFX   Klingons, including one WOMAN start materializing. (NB Separate BEAM-INS for Gorkon, Azetbur, Chang). Gorkon descends first. He is tall, splendidly barbaric.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chancellor Gorkon. The Klingons are lordly, formal; bow, taking in their surroundings. An ELECTRONIC BOSUN'S WHISTLE pipes them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Chancellor, may I present Commander Spock, whom I believe you know, Dr. Leonard McCoy, chief medical officer, Montgomery Scott, chief engineer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Spock) Commander, face to face at last.. you have my thanks.. Spock bows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Gentlemen, this is my daughter Azetbur... my military advisor Brigadier Kerla... and this is General Chang my chief of staff. Chang wears a PATCH over one eye. He advances on Kirk with a grim smile, lone eyeball to eyeball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've always wanted to meet you, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) I'm not sure how to take that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sincere admiration, Kirk -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soft) As one warrior to another...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ducks this) Uh, right this way, gentlemen. I thought you might enjoy a brief tour... The party leaves. As they move past TWO CREWMEN... They all look alike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about that smell? You know only the top of the line models can even talk. They turn to find themselves facing an expressionless Lieutenant Saavik.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You men have work? Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then snap to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: leaving the Enterprise Science Labs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your research laboratory is most impressive...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starfleet's been charting and cataloging planetary atmospheres. All vessels are equipped with chemical analytic sensors...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This cannot be easy for you, Captain... (off the look) I would feel awkward if I had to give you a tour of OUR vessel... The man's courtesy makes Kirk feel guilty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you care to go topside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling Kirk aside) Captain, you're not going to show them the bridge??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clenched teeth) Full diplomatic courtesy, Mr. Chekov... The party passes Uhura and a YOUNGER CREWMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you want your daughter to  marry one?

dialogues.speaker: VFX
dialogues.text: THE TWO SHIPS CRUISE PARALLEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WINDOW IRISES OPEN REVEALING the stars gliding by. A HAND POURS DEEP BLUE ROMULAN ALE into Gorkon's crystal goblet. Dinner well underway. Principles from both parties are at table. STEWARDS keep food and drink in motion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I give you a toast: the undiscovered country - (off their looks) the future. All drink ROMULAN ALE, echoing "the undiscovered country." The KLINGONS eat with their fingers, scorning utensils.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HAMLET, act three, scene one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have never experienced Shakespeare until you have read  him in the original Klingon. Chang turns to Kirk with a malicious twinkle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "To be or not to be, that is the question" which preoccupies our people, Captain Kirk. We need BREATHING room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I beg your pardon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Kirk, I thought Romulan ale was illegal. It takes Kirk a moment to regain his composure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the advantages of being  a thousand light years from Federation headquarters. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To you, Chancellor Gorkon: one of the architects of our future. All drink. As Romulan ale flows throughout the scene, tongues get looser. Gorkon WATCHES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps we are looking at something of that future here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander Spock, mindful of all your work behind the scenes, and despite the cordiality at this mess, I do not sense an acceptance of our people throughout your ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're naturally wary, ma'am. We've been at war a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do both sides overcome ingrained prejudice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps with a few small steps  at a time. Like this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And perhaps with a large step or two. Like a peace treaty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Kirk, are you willing to give up Starfleet? Kirk stares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at Kirk) I believe the Captain feels that Starfleet's mission has always  been one of peace -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glares) Far be it for me to dispute my first officer. Starfleet has always -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come now, Captain, this dinner  is off the record: in space all warriors are cold warriors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have never tried to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hypocritically presume that your democratic system gives you  a moral prerogative to force other cultures to conform to your politics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No? Uhura turns to the Klingon next to her - all tact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General, are YOU fond of Shakespeare? He looks at her, his hands and mouth full of food. Ugh. Chekov pursues -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do NOT impose democracy on others. We do believe that every planet has a sovereign claim to human rights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (spits) "Human rights." Even the name is racist. The Federation is basically a "homo sapiens" only club... SPOCK reacts to this. Chang is amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Present company excepted, to be sure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I suppose we're not perfect -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rising) Don't let them put words in your mouth - ! I haven't served 30 years in the engine room of a starship to be accused of gunboat diplomacy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In any case, we know where this is leading: the annihilation of our culture. Klingons will replace those on the lowest rung of the Federation employment ladder, taking menial jobs and performing them for lower pay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's economics, not racism -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you have to admit it adds up to the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be naive, Commander -!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who you calling naive -? Kirk stares sullenly down the table throughout this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're explorers not diplomats!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starfleet's killed an awful lot of natural phenomena in the name of "exploration"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow orders...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when has THAT been an excuse? Diplomacy must resolve these -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right - leave it to the politicians to muck it up and leave us defenseless...! A COUGH interrupts the fight. All eyes on Gorkon. The Klingons conceal their amusement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally) Well. I see we have a long way to go. Reactions from Kirk and his officers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both parties are gathered, saying goodbyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Captain Kirk. The evening has been most... edifying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wooden) We must do this again soon. Gorkon stares at him, smiles slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't trust me. Kirk can't look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I don't blame you. If there IS to be a Brave New World, we old people will have the hardest time living in it. Commander Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chancellor. A pleasure to meet you, Ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, Commander...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Chang, a pleasure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grins) "Parting is such sweet sorrow, shall we say goodnight till it be morrow?" Kirk is ready to slug him but turns his fist into a SALUTE. The Klingons step on the transporter platform. Chang speaks into his communicator, nods to Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Energize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 44   They disappear. The Bosun's whistle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see the way they ate? Terrible table manners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe our own conduct will distinguish us in the annals of diplomacy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to sleep it off. Let me know if there's some other way we can screw up tonight. He starts out; others follow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes in slightly drunk and pushes the button on his log. Lies on his bunk and speaks. The SHIP'S BELLS give 0100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain's log. Stardate 8679.15. The Enterprise hosted Chancellor Gorkon and company for dinner last night. Our manners were not exactly Emily Post. Note to the galley: Romulan ale no longer to be served at diplomatic functions. He leans back, sighs, thinking -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) But is wasn't the ale. That was just the excuse we needed to say all the things that were really on our minds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filtered) Captain Kirk, you are wanted on the bridge. Captain Kirk... Kirk reacts, tries to shake himself awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk enters. Glances at the main visual display: the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 46   battlecruiser still travels silently alongside.

dialogues.speaker: VFXA
dialogues.text: Saavik still has the conn. Spock is at his post.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rubs his eyes) What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am uncertain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock, I'm really tired...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are reading an enormous amount of neutron radiation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tries to focus) Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curiously it appears to emanate from us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Enterprise? Spock remains silent. Kirk is disturbed, paces, watching the displays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saavik, you know anything about a neutron energy surge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Chekov, anything unusual?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just the size of my head -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you mean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 46   A photon TORPEDO suddenly streaks from the bottom of VFXB   the screen and hits the hull of the President's flagship!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've fired on the Chancellor's ship -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Torpedo room--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura, monitor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Direct hit -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confirmed, Captain!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 46   A second photon shoots out from the bottom of the VFXC   display screen toward the President's ship

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frantic) Who's doing that? Saavik hits panel controls, trying to find out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gorkon, several advisors and soldiers were seated but the impact has thrown them about. They speak SUBTITLED KLINGON. The entire FLAGSHIP is drenched in AMBER emergency LIGHT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're hit --! Another blast. They start floating helplessly in the air! Everything mobile RISES...WEAPONS FLOAT OUT OF REACH...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gravity generator!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 48   TWO SETS OF HEAVY GRAVITY BOOTS as they materialize. VFXA   The legs inside them wear STARFLEET UNIFORMS and carry PHASERS at their sides. They SHOOT the Klingon Transporter OFFICER. They STOMP HEAVILY through the ALARMS and chaos, firing at the helpless, floating CREW... CRIES of wounded... WEAPONS FLOAT out of their holsters just out of reach in the AMBER LIGHT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where Klingon crew are FLOATING helplessly. The GRAVITY BOOTS shoot anything in their way, WALK ON WALLS, etc. as they hurry along to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where they BLAST a GUARD at the door, SEVERING HIS ARM and enter. The KLINGONS have weapons but are floating and unable to aim. They are quickly shot as the two HIT MEN make their way toward Gorkon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 50   BLOOD NOW FLOATS about as well as debris in the VFX   crackling emergency lighting. A good deal of HISSIN STEAM... Chancellor Gorkon is shot. The Hit Men turn and exit quickly. Linger on a scene of WEIGHTLESS carnage and assassination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hit Men hurry back the way they came in their

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 51   awkward magnetic boots. Bodies and blood floating VFX   around them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 52   The HEAVY BOOTS step on the platform and de-material

dialogues.speaker: VFX
dialogues.text: (One FOOT TREADS ON FLOATING KLINGON BLOOD)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 53   A snowy picture on the visual display, then Chang co VFXA   on (still in AMBER LIGHT)...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (He's screaming in Klingon, reverting to his native language under stress.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says we've fired on them in a blatant act of war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HAVEN'T fired -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to the data bank, we HAVE - twice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, they're coming about!

dialogues.speaker: VFXB
dialogues.text: the battlecruiser/flagship now heading for Enterprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're preparing to fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shields up, Captain --? Kirk hasn't moved. He's staring at the display, thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, our shields -- !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura, signal our surrender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Enterprise. We surrender.  Repeat  Enterprise surrenders --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, if they fire at us with our shields down --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Torpedo bay! DID we fire those torpedoes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty at the console.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Negative, Captain. According to Inventory we're still fully loaded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON SPOCK reacting. How can this be? He checks DATA BANKS again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 56   CU DATA BANKS: they reconfirm - two photon torpedoes VFX   fired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand down your weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, if --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand DOWN, Mr. Scott. All stop. That's an order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir. Bones hurries in, carrying his stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the Hell's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I knew. Uhura?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's pretty chaotic over there. There's been some weapons fire  and a lot of shouting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going aboard. Spock, you have the conn. He heads for the transporter room. Spock blocks him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (blocks Kirk) I am responsible for involving you in this. I will go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bitter) I'M going. You are going to be responsible for getting me out of this. Meantime we're not going to be the instigators of a full-scale war on the eve of universal peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps you're right. And Spock uncharacteristically pats him on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Good luck, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going too. They may need a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura, tell them we're coming. And tell them we're unarmed. They hurry out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chang and his ASSISTANTS are trying to sort things out without gravity. Chang shouts efficient orders in Klingon as he finds and tries to help Gorkon... Chang keeps himself upright by grabbing a handhold, but the stricken are still floating... A few more orders from Chang, then the lights flicker, then all the bodies and BLOOD slam to the ground as the gravitational source is restored. Lighting is "NORMAL."

dialogues.speaker: VFX
dialogues.text: Kirk and Bones materialize. They are quickly surrounded by ARMED SOLDIERS. Kirk puts his hands out to indicate they are not carrying weapons. They are searched as Kerla enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you lost your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I give you my word I don't understand what has happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're here to help...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hesitates; furious) Follow me. He leads them along the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: same path - a scene of destruction - which the hit men took, right into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where dead and wounded are being separated. Kerla hurries over to Gorkon, askew on a rug, blood running everywhere. Azetbur is holding him, now bloody herself (she wasn't in the room during the assassination).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chancellor Gorkon! He goes to him immediately. Chang rises from next to Gorkon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, what happened here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You feign ignorance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You crippled our gravitational field with a direst torpedo hit, and two Starfleet crewmen beamed aboard in magnetic boots and did this! WE HAVE WITNESSES! Kirk has no response, is shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim! Bones is being held back from Gorkon by two Klingons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a DOCTOR!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can I trust --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you carrying a surgeon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enraged) We were until your torpedoes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let me help! Chang hesitates; signals. Bones is released.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need some light. Can we get him onto the table...? KLINGONS lift Gorkon onto his table; someone produces LIGHT. Bones whips out his medical scanner. His hands are SHAKING. A spage-age REMBRANDT painting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet Jesus...! He's lost a lot of whatever this stuff is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you - ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, I don't even know his anatomy. Bones furiously goes over Gorkon with his anabolic photoplaser. Shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) The wounds aren't closing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're killing him! Kirk grabs Chang before he can get to Bones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chancellor Gorkon, can you hear me? Chancellor...? No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Father...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gone into some kind of arrest... come on, dammit! He tries a medical tricorder. Frantically, he WHUMPS Gorkon's chest... as Kirk et al, look, Gorkon feebly opens his eyes, sees Kirk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all right? HE FREEZES; Bones looks at the scanner. It burns bright red. Gorkon is dead. Kirk is in shock: he was for real. Azetbur sits holding Gorkon, dry-eyed. Kirk has to pull the stunned Bones away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grim triumph) Under article 184 of Interstellar Law, I place you both under arrest. You are charged with assassinating the Chancellor of the High Council.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just tried to save him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Klingon) Take them away. They are handcuffed. Both are in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura is listening carefully. Scotty has joined Spock and the others on the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've been arrested. All eyes go to Spock. We can guess how he feels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Spock, we've got to do something! The others crowd in, waiting for orders. Depending on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally) I assume command of this ship as of (he checks) 0130 hours. Uhura, send to Starfleet HQ. Explain precisely what has taken place, and request instructions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we can't allow them to be taken back to Kronos as prisoners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you suggest, Lieutenant? Opening fire won't retrieve the Captain; and an armed engagement was precisely what he wished to avoid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least we must keep track of where they are taken, sir. I -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've already addressed that question, Mr. Scott. We'll e able to follow the Captain's movements.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you - ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the meantime we must endeavor to piece together what happened here tonight. According to our data banks, this ship fired those torpedoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Scott, you forget yourself. Please accompany me. He starts out -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if we can't piece together what happened? What then? Sir. Spock turns unhappily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Mr. Chekov, it resides in the hands of the diplomats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The FEDERATION PRESIDENT and the KLINGON AMBASSADOR. With them is the VULCAN AMBASSADOR, SAREK - Spock's father - and NANCLUS, the ROMULAN AMBASSADOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chancellor of the High Council is dead - the result of an unprovoked attack while he traveled to see YOU under a flag of truce on a mission of peace. Captain Kirk was legally arrested for the crime. May I remind you that he and Doctor McCoy boarded KRONOS ONE of their own free will. None of these facts are in dispute, Mr. President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will demand a full investigation. You can be assured we will cooperate with all our power to get to the bottom of the matter. In the meantime --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the meantime we expect the Federation to abide by the articles of Interstellar Law you claim to cherish. Kirk and Doctor McCoy WILL stand trial for the assassination of Chancellor Gorkon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the question. Ambassador Sarek, there must be some way to extradite these men -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heavily) Mr. President, I share a measure of personal responsibility in this matter, but I am obliged to confirm my esteemed colleagues legal interpretation: Kirk and Dr. McCoy were properly arrested, and the Klingons are within their rights to try them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what is the position of the Romulan government, Ambassador Nanclus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wily) In the absence of specific instructions from my government, I must concur with my colleagues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But surely you cannot believe that James Kirk assassinated the Chancellor of the High Council.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ("reluctant") Mr. President, I don't know what to believe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am waiting for your answer, Mr. President. Long pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This President is not above the law. The Klingon Ambassador bows and takes his leave. The President is left with the two Ambassadors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President, Starfleet Command is here from San Francisco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send them in. Three OFFICERS from Starfleet - including Admiral Donald and the CinC - enter from a DIFFERENT DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral Donald...Bill...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President we cannot allow Federation citizens to be abducted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At present I'm awaiting a full report from Enterprise. Pending that I am constrained to observe Interstellar Law. A stand off. Donald nods to another OFFICER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've prepared Operation Retrieve based on the rising danger of terrorism and hostility between the Klingon empire and the Federation. (hands the President a CD) Put simply, we can go in and rescue the Starfleet hostages and be out in 24 hours with an acceptable rate of loss in manpower and equipment. We have the technology --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suppose you precipitate a full scale war?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, quite frankly, Mr. President we can clean their chronometers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President, they ARE vulnerable. There'll never be a better time... Pause as the President considers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd prefer not to be the President to push the button if I can avoid it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The longer we wait, the less accessible the hostages will be, Mr. President.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bear it in mind, Admiral. I think that's all. Sir. The President looks at him. (continuing) Those men have literally saved this planet - and you know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do know it. And I'm afraid they're going to save it again. By standing trial. They're dismissed. The President puts his head in his hands...finally looks up at Sarek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know I agree with everything they said?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mr. President. And I know my son must feel equally responsible. It was at my request that he persuaded Kirk to undertake this mission. The President looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want the crew of Enterprise in my office tomorrow morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're still in space, Mr. President - adjacent to the Neutral Zone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then tell your son to get the hell back here before the end of the week. He swallows some pills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura's communications panel. Chekov stands over her shoulder. In Uhura's EARPIECE we can HEAR filtered SCREAMING! She can hardly stand the volume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (understates) We're to report back at once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We cannot abandon Captain Kirk and Doctor McCoy. He looks at the rest of the CREW. Lt. Saavik wanders over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Trouble?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reluctant) We've been ordered to -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In nineteenth century France, workers who felt their livelihood threatened by machines, flung their wooden shoes - called SABOTS - into the gears to stop them. Hence the word SABOTAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are experiencing a technical malfunction. All backup systems inoperative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excellent. I mean too bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will inform Captain Spock.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICE OF THE FEDERATION PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: The President is meeting with SIX civilian ADVISERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have our total support, Mister President. My factories are standing by. We can gear up to full weapons production in less than a week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Henry. Right now we're pursuing diplomatic channels...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. No one wants a war...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I may, Mr. President. The important thing is to keep the peace process alive. If the new Chancellor is so disposed, perhaps we can attach a rider, get some assurance that these men won't be executed. Then, in a year -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President, you have the new Chancellor of the High Council calling. They all swing to look at the far wall, which

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 65   lights up as a visual display. After a snowy VFX   beginning, Azetbur appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President, I've been named Chancellor of the High Council in my father's place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reactions in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madam Chancellor, you have my sincerest condolences on your recent loss. I want to assure you that this shameful deed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President, let us come to the point: you want the conference to go forward and so did my father. I will attend in one week - after I've had the opportunity to master the details of this position - on one condition: we will not extradite the prisoners and you will not attempt to rescue them in a military operation. We would consider any such attempt an act  of war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We look forward to meeting with you next week, Madam Chancellor. I hope you will be our guest here on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After recent events you will understand I prefer a neutral site. And in the interests of security, let us keep the location secret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you wish, Madam Chancellor. She clicks off. The President and his advisers are a little speechless at her strength and brusqueness. More pills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: she's just gotten off the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attack them now, Madam Chancellor - while we still can...! He unfurls battle plans...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attack or be slaves in their world!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can take whole by force what they propose to divide...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weary) You don't seem to understand our situation, General. War is... obsolete. As we are in danger of becoming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better to die on our feet than live on our knees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quickly) That wasn't what my father wanted -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bitter) He was killed for what he wanted. That sinks in. Azetbur hardens. Faces Chang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk must have a fair trial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stony) But I want a conviction. You will represent the State, General Chang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the greatest pleasure, Madam Chancellor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock and Scotty hover over the torpedo console, looking at numbers and lights. Spock thinks hard. EIGHT BELLS SOUND. It is perfectly clear: according to the "INVENTORY" program ALL TORPEDOES ARE STILLL ABOARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's as I said, Mr. Spock: Inventory still registers every torpedo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (musing) Yet the data banks insist we fired: twice. One computer is lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A computer canna lie, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think  not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can check the torpedoes visually, if you like -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll have to check every one of them, Mr. Scott.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That could take hours!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nevertheless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if they're still in place?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then someone forged a data bank entry. Lieutenant Saavik descends into the bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've named Gorkon's daughter Chancellor - it was on the news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll bet that Klingon bitch killed her father...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her own father...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such things have happened before, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't place the same value on life that we do, Spock - you know that... take my word: she didn't shed one bloody tear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's hardly conclusive, Mr. Scott, as Klingons have no tear ducts. Before he can react.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Any reply from Starfleet to our dispatch, Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not as yet, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curious. You haven't been assisting Commander Uhura with her radio transmissions, have you, Lt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander Uhura has been experiencing technical difficulties sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very well. For twenty-four hours we'll agree that this conversation did not take place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An omission. After that -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty-four hours from now we won't have a clue where the Captain is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know precisely where he'll be. Scotty and Lieutenant Saavik react.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do? Where?

dialogues.speaker: VFX
dialogues.text: THE KLINGON EMPIRE IN ALL ITS BARBARIC SPLENDOR A cavernous stadium arranged in circular tiers cut from jagged stone. A place from a bygone age, of savage and awesome beauty. Something between a CIRCUS and a CATHEDRAL. ... turned for the occasion into a gigantic COURTROOM with thousands of spectators... SCREAMING: "KIRK! KIRK! KIRK! Many in the AUDIENCE hold SPEARS with lighted HEADS. Kirk and Bones in the dock, stand in the bottom at the very center of the circle, surrounded by a Klingon AUDIENCE in rising tiers, while HOODED KLINGON JUDGES sit invisible in a darkened dugout. (One Judge is an ALBINO.) CHANG wears the prosecutor's mantle. In the audience is President Azetbur and her ADVISORS. The trial is being BROADCAST and special CAMERAS abound. Near Kirk and Bones sit their young, eager Klingon DEFENSE ATTORNEY. Kirk keeps his cool throughout, though Bones tends to steam. The rules are different. Attorneys are empowered to ask anyone present a question at any time. And to mix this up with statements and charges. The proceedings BEGIN in subtitled KLINGON. Kirk and Bones wear HEADPHONES. When they speak a TRANSLATOR converts to Klingon... As Chang gets going, we ZOOM into his MOUTH and he converts to ENGLISH... the JUDGES' GAVEL IS A GROTESQUE MAILED GLOVE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The State will show that Enterprise fired on KRONOS One without provocation, the Chancellor and his advisers having been lulled into a false sense of security with an invitation to a state dinner aboard Captain Kirk's vessel at 1930 hours that same evening. Do you deny all this? The mob howls "Kirk!" as the Judge gavels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Prisoner will respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't deny we invited them to dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you drunk at that dinner, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 72   The President and his ADVISERS, including Sarek, wat VFX   the proceedings unhappily onscreen. TRANSLATOR'S VOICE OVER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it a fact that you served Romulan ale, a beverage illegal in the Federation because of its overwhelming potency?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drink WAS served... The CinC and President wince - This is a damned show trial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you still maintain your ship did not fire on Kronos One? Would you have known if she had? Come now, Captain. The record clearly there were no other ships in the sector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There... were no other ships in the sector.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you have occasion to refer to your ship's data banks during that night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I checked the data banks, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what did they tell you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reluctant) That we fired two photon torpedoes. But - The mob howls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The witness is excused - for the time being. Chang whirls off as the Judge gavels...

dialogues.speaker: START ON TV
dialogues.text: One of PRESIDENT GORKON'S GUARDS is on the stand. He is MISSING AN ARM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After the first hit, we lost our gravitational field; I found myself weightless and unable to function. Then 2 Starfleet crewmen came walking toward us -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock et al are receiving the transmission on their main visual display. They watch in silence. TRANSLATOR'S VOICE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps they merely wore Starfleet uniforms -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I move that remark be stricken as purely speculative...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So ordered. Colonel Worf, we are interested in facts, not theories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the gravitational field was not functioning, how could these men have been walking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They appeared to be wearing magnetic boots. Murmur. The Defense Attorney wishes he hadn't asked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gravity boots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They fired on you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Starfleet issue phasers. They dashed into the Chancellor's stateroom, we could hear more phaser fire; then they went back the way they'd come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Towards the transporter room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. SWISH PAN TO CU SULU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sulu and his crew are watching the trial on their visual display as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor McCoy, what is your current medical status?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aside from a touch of arthritis, I'd say pretty good. Sulu has to smile. Chang is not amused; waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) For 27 years I have been Ship's Surgeon and later Chief Medical Officer aboard the USS Enterprise. In three months I'm due to stand down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Retire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soft) Ah. I believe you also consumed Romulan ale at the officers' mess on the night of question, Doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sustained...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry) We all did. But that doesn't mean -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Chang, come to the point or abandon this line of inquiry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was Chancellor Gorkon alive when you first examined him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you saved patients as "barely" alive as he was? President Azetbur flinches at the memory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't have the knowledge of Klingon anatomy I needed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say you are due for retirement. May I ask: do your hands shake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Overruled -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was nervous -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were incompetent! - whether deliberately or as a result of age combined with drink this court will determine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried to save him! I was desperate to save him! He was the last best hope in the universe for real peace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chancellor herself will testify that the defendant's hands shook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 79   The President et al watch unhappily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now we come to the architect of this tragic affair, Captain James Tiberius Kirk. I put it to you, Captain, that you were seeking revenge for the death of your son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That isn't true...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That, either as an instrument of Federation policy or acting on your own drunken initiative, you and your fellow conspirators crippled KRONOS One and cold-bloodedly assassinated the Chancellor of the High Council. Then you and Doctor McCoy went aboard to make certain the job was complete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection: Captain Kirk has not been identified as the assassin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sustained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I offer into the record the following excerpt from Captain Kirk's personal log. He signals. Kirk's VOICE fills the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have never trusted Klingons and never will. I have never been able to forgive them for the murder of my boy... An explosive babble fills the court. The Judge POUNDS HIS GLOVE for order... QUICK REACTION SHOTS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are those your words?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spoken by you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Louder, please. We cannot hear you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (firmer) Those words WERE spoken by me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 85   Sulu is speaking confidentially to his communication VFX   officer. Onscreen behind them the trial continues

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send to commander Enterprise: "We stand ready to assist you. Captain Sulu, USS Excelsior." Attach our co-ordinates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that wise, sir? I mean, given their situation - (off Sulu's look) Aye, sir. He leaves. Sulu looks up at the screen, unhappily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection, your honors. My clients' political views are not on trial here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 86   The trial is on SEVERAL MONITORS BG. Spock, next to VFX   Uhura

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sulu's giving us his position and telling us he's standing by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unhappy) He's placing himself in a most awkward position...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the contrary, Captain Kirk's views and motives are at the heart of the matter. This officer's record shows the accused to be an insubordinate, unprincipled career opportunist with a history of violating the chain of command when it suited him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Indeed the record will show that "Captain" Kirk was once "Admiral" Kirk and that Admiral Kirk was broken for taking matters into his own hands in defiance of regulations and the law. Do you deny you were demoted on these charges, Captain? DO NOT WAIT FOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't answer - objection -!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Objection overruled. The Prisoner will answer the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cannot deny it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were demoted...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For insubordination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have on occasion disobeyed orders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you were obeying or disobeying orders the night you arranged the assassination of Chancellor Gorkon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping) I object -!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping) I was unaware of the assassination until I boarded his ship!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping) You deny Enterprise fired on KRONOS One?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping) You deny that your men beamed aboard KRONOS One and shot the Chancellor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I cannot confirm or deny actions which I did not witness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Kirk, are you aware that under Federation law, the Captain of a Starship is considered responsible for the actions of his  men?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So if it should prove members of your crew did in fact carry out such an assassination - ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim! They're setting us up! Your honors, I protest-!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The defendant will be silent! Captain Kirk, you will answer the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (heavily) As Captain I am responsible for the conduct of the crew under my command.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your honors, the State rests. An excited BABBLE. Kirk and Bones turn to their attorney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it our turn, now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grim) According to Klingon law both sides present their cases at the same time; we've HAD our turn. On Bones' and Kirk's reaction, the Judge's mailed fist crashes down with a flurry of sparks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is the judgment of this court that the defendants are guilty as charged. Sensation in court. A BOOMING CHANT "KOOM! KOOM!" as all the LIGHT SPEARS are pointed at Kirk and Bones. Chang is stone-faced. AGAIN THE HORRIBLE GAUNTLET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain James T. Kirk, Doctor Leonard McCoy... They face the Judge's box. INTERCUT THIS MOMENT WITH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SPOCK'S FACE - what has he done?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have either of you anything to say before this court passes sentence? Kirk and Bones look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (simply) We were framed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rises passionately) I wish to note for the record that the evidence against my clients is entirely circumstantial. I beg the court to consider this when framing its sentence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) So noted. In view of Colonel Worf's plea, the sentence of death is commuted. It is the judgment of this court that without possibility of reprieve or parole, you be taken from this place to the Dilithium Mines on the penal asteroid archipelago of Rura Penthe, there to spend the rest of your natural lives. Off Kirk's and Bones' reactions

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (her eyes fill) Rura Penthe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Known throughout the galaxy as the Aliens' graveyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better to kill them now and get it over with... It takes Spock a moment to recover himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see it again, Lieutenant. Saavik instructs the panel. As attention is diverted, Spock mops his brow. The CREW watch in silence as the MONITOR REPLAYS THE HIT.  (sc.46 VFXB)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hopeless) It is Enterprise. We fired. As the replay indicates this, Spock stares...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anger & confusion) It's na possible!! All weapons VISUALLY accounted for. Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commander? This is most difficult to say, but has it occurred to... to any of us... that the Captain is... that is, we know his feelings about Klingons, what they did to his... Spock's gaze stops her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Well, it IS possible. After an impenetrable pause -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again. Another replay as they watch. (OVERSHOULDER)  (Sc46 VFXC)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Hold. They stare at the frozen image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) An ancestor of mine maintained that if you eliminate the impossible whatever remains - however improbable - must be the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What exactly does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means that if we cannot have fired those torpedoes then someone else did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They dinna fire on themselves. And there were no other ships present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grasping at straws) There was an enormous neutron energy surge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (insisting) Not from us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (square one) A neutron surge that big could only be produced by another ship...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRONOS One?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too far off. Very near us. Perhaps... underneath us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If another ship had been beneath us the Klingons would've seen her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would they? Long pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Bird of Prey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cloaked!? Spock says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Bird of Prey canna fire when she's cloaked!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thoughtful) This one can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They you're talking about a dreadful new engine of destruction, Mr. Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must inform Starfleet Command -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enraged) Inform them of what? A new weapon that isn't visible? Raving lunatics - that's what they'll call us! They'll say we're so desperate to exonerate the Captain we'll say anything -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they'd be right. We have no evidence - just a theory that happens to fit the facts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even assuming you're correct, Mr. Spock, why would they fire on their own President?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (decision) I want this ship searched from bow to stern. Lieutenant Saavik, you are in charge. Start with the transporter room and work your way outwards...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not understand. If there was a ship underneath us, surely the assassins beamed aboard from that vessel, not Enterprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're forgetting something. (off their looks) the data banks say WE fired. If we did, the killers are here; if we didn't, whoever altered the data banks is here. Either way, what we're searching for is here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What ARE we searching for, Mr. Spock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell them, Lieutenant. It's elementary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two pairs of gravity boots. Spock is well pleased with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 91   THREE SUNS glare down on a huge vista: an ICE FIELD VFX   - the coldest habitable place in the solar system. A small moving DARK MASS as we push in, REVEALS FIFTEEN PRISONERS in leg irons and FIVE KLINGON GUARDS with JACKAL-MASTIFFS moving slowly across the frigid plain. Kirk and Bones, likewise shackled, are among them. GUARDS and PRISONERS alike wear ragged furs. They reach a lone TOTEM and a GUARD holds up his hand for a halt. He presses an instrument emitting a high- pitched WHINE. In response, A HUGE TRAP DOOR, buried in the snow, yawns open. A KLINGON GUARD emerges from steps below and places a BOX before the gaping DOOR. As Kirk and Bones watch, the COMMANDANT of RURA PENTHE and his JACKAL MASTIFF emerge. He mounts the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Rura Penthe. Observe: there is no stockade, no guard tower, no electrified frontier. They are not needed. Only a magnetic shield prevents beaming. Your new home is underground. He blows a mechanical WHISTLE: in response, TWO GUARDS emerge from below with a SCREAMING KLINGON CONVICT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Punishment means EXILE from prison to the surface - on the surface nothing can survive. The GUARDS dump the screaming CONVICT on the ice -  without furs. The weather immobilizes him at once - his cries become fainter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Below no one can escape. Work well and you will be treated well. Work badly and you will die. He leaves; the box is removed by a guard and proceeds him through the huge door and down the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the prisoners are herded after him and the door shuts, leaving the frozen vista as it was; snow flurries obscure the trap door almost instantly. Only the frozen corpse of the CONVICT is left - until it too is covered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: START LOOKING UP AT THE CLOSING TRAP DOOR - outside we can see SNOW flurries as the panel shuts with a CLANG. PAN DOWN TO REVEAL A huge underground labyrinth with an enormous courtyard surrounded by prisoner huts open to the center. PRISONERS wander freely within. The scum of the universe. Everyone wears furs, LEG IRONS and is FREEZING. On endless scaffolding above, the GUARDS. Many of the PRISONERS look like they could snap Kirk and Bones in two with one hand. Kirk and Bones step gingerly around the outside wall, watching the yard. A shadow falls across them. Their POV: It's a behemoth ALIEN. He speaks in a guttural, incomprehensible language.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quog wok na pushnat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid our universal translator was confiscated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ring notsa loskent!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
