dialogues.text: Rangnit ascru, unto pram moreoscue shondik!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's definitely on about something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quog wok na pushnat!! The alien picks Kirk up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this is your spot, we'll move on... The Alien is about to behead Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants your obedience to the Brotherhood of Aliens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fraid not. It wouldn't fit him, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krandog aranty. The Alien puts Kirk down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Fendo pompsky. The Alien nods and wanders off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the Brotherhood of Aliens?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prisoners from outside the Klingon system. They tend to band together. I'm Martia. She's a tall and very good looking female, boots to her thighs, exotic furs, tattered but clearly humanoid. She's smoking something; offers them a hit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) This'll help keep you warm. You're Kirk and McCoy. Kirk takes the hit; offers Bones... it does warm you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks around) There's a reward for your death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks around too) Figures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been set up all along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) We don't get many presidential assassins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't kill Gorkon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadpan) Of course not. Anyway, somebody up there wants you out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe we can get more out of the way than this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll make it look like an accident...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you in for, if you don't mind me asking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mind. Smuggling. Guilty. I come from Arc. Smuggling is an ancient and respected trade there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much time's left of your sentence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles grimly) Don't you know? Everyone on Rura Penthe is here for life. Kirk and Bones didn't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under Lt. Saavik's watchful eye, CREWMEN are taking the kitchen apart. All sorts of dishes and cutlery litter the place. Spock, Scotty, and Chekov enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any progress?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (head shake) We've got a crew of three hundred turning their own quarters inside out,  but the killers may be among them. Surely they've disposed of these boots by now. Wouldn't it have been logical to leave them on Gorkon's ship?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even logic must give way to physics. Gravity hadn't been restored by the time they escaped. Without their boots they would not have stayed on the Klingon transporter pads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mimes with his finger) Why not simply vaporize them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like this? She whips out her PHASER and FIRES, incinerating a POT. ALARMS and CLAXONS HOWL! Chekov COVERS HIS EARS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you know, sir, no one can fire an unauthorized phaser aboard a starship. She switches off the ALARM and has another thought:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Suppose when they returned they threw the boots into the garbage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm having the garbage searched. If my surmise is correct these boots will cling to the killers' necks like Tiberian bats. They couldn't make their escape without them; nor can they simply throw them out a window for all to see; no - they're here. Somewhere. Uhura comes into the galley, stepping over pots and pans. She's not happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did someone shoot off a phaser? Mr. Spock. He turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I've pulled out my - uh wooden shoe and Starfleet is screaming for us to return to port.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Scott, any progress on repairing our warp drive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing wrong with the bloody - Spock coughs hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) - could take weeks, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mr. Scott. We were to return to spacedock, the killers would surely manage to dispose of their incriminating footwear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An error.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unhappily) I'll tell them someone threw a gravity boot into it... ANGLE ON SPOCK reacting. He looks at Saavik...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, a gravity boot in the warp drive... She goes off, shaking her head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You understand that we have lost all contact with Captain Kirk...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At present, he's surrounded by a magnetic shield. If my calculations are correct, he should be deep into his escape planning by this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk gets hit in the face. It's already BLOODY. It's a prison fight. Kirk and an ALIEN are surrounded by PRISONERS & GUARDS cheering and jeering. Kirk and Bones are distinctly grubbier. Kirk scrambles to his feet and circles. The Alien swings a large paw but Kirk ducks, comes in with an uppercut. He connects, but does little damage. They circle some more. The Alien dives legs first and scissors Kirk, who goes down roughly. Wrestling, Kirk slips free. Bones and Martia watch... the leg irons make it complicated - they can also wrap around someone's neck... The Alien moves in closely, hits Kirk again. Kirk fights back with a kick to the chest, which doubles over the Alien.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 93   Then Kirk slams the ALIEN on the neck and he goes do Kirk starts to walk away. But a paw reaches out and grabs him by the ankle. Kirk looks back and the Alien is grinning, drags him in. Stands and grips Kirk's chest to back in a giant bear hug. Surely he will crush the life out of Kirk. He lifts Kirk right off the ground. Kirk, almost gone, lifts his legs up high and swings down hard, smashing the Alien in the knee. That does it. The Alien falls to the ground, screaming and holding his knee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll respect him now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a comfort...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was lucky that thing had knees. They look back. The Alien is still on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not his knee. (off Kirk's look) Not everybody keeps their genitals in the same place, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything else you want to tell me? Before she can answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Bones, why don't you see what you can do? Let them know we're not holding a grudge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suppose HE'S holding a grudge? Bones tentatively goes forward and examines the knee. He is without any medical tools of any kind. The Alien yells but let's him look. He manipulates the leg, then ties a kind of splint with an old rag... Kirk looks at Martia. She shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When whoever it is makes their move, you won't be here to ask if he's the one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's gotta be a way out of this place... She looks at him, moves off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sulu is asleep; awakened by a knock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in...? His COMMUNICATIONS OFFICER enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to wake you, sir, but Starfleet urgently requests any data we may have on the whereabouts of Enterprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (groggy) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apparently they're refusing to acknowledge signal to return to spacedock, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Signal Starfleet that... we have no idea location of Enterprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (astonished) Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You having hearing problems, mister?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir. The man salutes and leaves. Sulu stays awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk and Bones try to sleep on rude cots in a hut off the main courtyard: tattered, exhausted wrecks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three months till retirement. What a way to finish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking) We're not finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speak for yourself. One day... one night... He makes a gesture across his own throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) - Kobayashi Maru... CLOSE ON KIRK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones, are you afraid of the  future?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was the general idea I intended to convey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean this future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we playing multiple choice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some people ARE afraid of the future; of what MIGHT happen; (pause) I was frightened, really frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Specifically of...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more neutral zone. I was USED to hating Klingons... that's why I failed in our assignment. (guilty) It never even occurred to me to take Gorkon at his word. Spock was right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, don't be too hard on yourself - we all felt exactly the same -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head; can't put his finger) Uh uh. Somebody felt much worse. And I'm starting to understand why.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if you've got any bright ideas, now's the time to - Suddenly, Kirk puts a hand over Bones' mouth. They pretend to sleep. Something crawls towards them in the dark; they sweat... Kirk clenches his fists...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) Kirk? It's me, Martia. Kirk opens his eyes; Bones plays possum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Listen. No one has ever escaped from Rura Penthe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ready) Except us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It IS possible. He regards her warily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I know how to get outside the shield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do we come in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting outside the shield is easy. After that it's up to you to get us off the surface before we freeze. Can you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Possibly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't make it alone. You're the likeliest candidate to come to this god-forsaken place in months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candidate for what? Their whispering has brought them very close. Martia is vamping him. She pulls off her fur hood... kisses him. He doesn't resist.

dialogues.speaker: BONES
dialogues.text: rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A partnership. Go to "C" Lift in the morning for mining duty. I'll meet you there. She disappears into the shadows. Bones, who has been watching the whole thing, gets up on one elbow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it with you, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still think we're finished?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More than ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the wind howls in an otherwise barren landscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chekov is examining the platform and environs carefully. He comes across spots of VIOLET. He scrapes samples into an evidence tube, and seals it; then hurries out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock studies the sample under a microscope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klingon blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They must have walked through it when it was floating and tracked it back here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the first evidence that corroborates our theory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we go to Starfleet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we expand our search to include uniforms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALL uniforms? Spock looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starts out) Aye, sir... ALL uniforms...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mister Chekov. Chekov turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) The longer we take, the greater danger in which we leave the Captain and Doctor McCoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 101   MONTAGE; the Enterprise is strip-searched. LOCKERS,

dialogues.speaker: THRU WARDROOMS, LAUNDRY, SICKBAY, JEFFERIES TUBE, CUPBO
dialogues.text: 105   OBSERVATION DECK, INSTRUMENTS PANELS, etc... you na it... piles and piles of CLOTHING being sorted by the CREW; piles of BOOTS being examined as Lieutenant Saavik prowls the CORRIDORS and checks off locations on a LIGHTPLAN of the ship...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly an EXCLAMATION brings her running over. A CREWMAN has opened a LOCKER and now holds up an enormous gravity BOOT. As all watch, he puts the boot on the METAL LOCKER... It sticks. Saavik looks up at the locker and sees the name: DAX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LATER Spock, Saavik, Uhura, Chekov, et al wait with impassive faces as CREWMAN DAX enters the area. He is an alien.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are Crewman Dax?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir. What's happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (triumphant) Perhaps you know the Romulan epic of Cinderella? If the shoe fits, wear it! Dax looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: no way those webbed feet could make it into those boots. Expressions of chagrin on everyone's face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk and Bones, their legs still shackled, walk across the huge courtyard and line up behind a dozen brutes, everyone flapping arms to keep warm... They wait in front of and then enter the C Lift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like the old Welsh mine caged elevators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks for the girl) I think we've been had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you weren't, Doctor. They look around. No girl. Just a big BRUTE next to them. Plus other CONVICTS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get off at the first level and join the gang going into the mine. (explains) They don't take girls. It's him! With her voice. Kirk is thunderstruck. He stares at the Brute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk and Bones climb out with the others. They follow the Brute through the labyrinthine darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of creature is this? Last night you two were spooning -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't remind me.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE MINE
dialogues.text: Everyone is issued a DRILL and a LIGHT HELMET.  As BEAMS ricochet about, they start digging DILITHIUM crystals out of the rock and putting them on a flatbed shuttle. Kirk and Bones and the Brute do likewise, all under the watchful eye of fur-clad KLINGON GUARDS. An ALIEN next to Kirk sneaks several of the crystals into his garment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 113   A GUARD blasts him with a PHASER and he disappears.

dialogues.speaker: VFX
dialogues.text: Bones openly takes his crystal and places it on the truck, making sure the guard sees him.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Kirk and Bones are filthy and sweaty. The Brute looks at them, looks around. The guards are eating with their backs turned. Kirk and Bones look to the Brute for guidance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 114   Before their eyes, he re-materializes into a TEENAG VFX   GIRL.

dialogues.speaker: CU HER SKINNY LEGS
dialogues.text: as Kirk and Bones watch, she slips out of her leg irons. Too bad they can't do likewise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) Follow me. She puts her DRILL down and walks silently into the depths of the mine. They follow, looking back to make sure the Guards aren't watching. The girl quickly scrambles through the small hole, turns and waves them on. They have to get down on their stomachs and crawl through. Kirk goes first, turns, pulls Bones. This takes time, especially if your legs have chains on them...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE GUARDS
dialogues.text: who finish their lunch and look around. Notice a suspicious space where 3 workers used to be. Wander over. Look further into the mine. Find the hole. They hurry back, shouting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hole has led to a new tunnel and the girl rematerializes into THE BRUTE as they crawl. Kirk and Bones, still chained, struggle to keep up. They make their way to a large, abandoned opening and come out on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a high ice ledge. By scrambling down the ledge and jumping, the BRUTE leads them onto the frigid snowfield. The surface environment is killing.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: The three slip and slide on the ice across a frozen river. The ICE BEGINS TO CRACK beneath their feet... Eventually the three climb the farther bank. They are barely alive. Shaking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't... Frantically, Kirk tries to keep Bones' circulation going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're at the edge of the shield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 119   They follow her look: AN ICE DESERT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. KEEP MOVING! They stagger on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock, out of uniform, reclines in his berth, eyes open; thinking. His expression changes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The votive candle burning in its shrine. Spock's eyes narrow. What is the candle trying to tell him...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Spock, I've got them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A blinking BLIP on Uhura's oscilloscope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There they are! PULL BACK. Uhura is monitoring their position. Spock, Scotty and Chekov stand over her shoulder. Spock heads for his console and starts peering at electronic charts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're outside the beaming shield. Mr. Scott, start your engines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, aye, sir. Scotty heads for the lift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (from the helm) Mr. Spock, Rura Penthe's deep in Klingon territory. If we're discovered...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks up) Quite right, Mr. Chekov. What is now required is a feat of linguistic legerdemain - and a degree of intrepidity. Before the Captain and Doctor McCoy freeze  to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grimly, under funded and undermanned. God knows what forsaken place this is. Rocks are lit by SCOPES... A SLEEPY KLINGON dozes before his scanners. A bottle in front of him tells the story. SUDDENLY A BLIP. HE forces himself into alert attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the scope a BLEEPING DOT... he frowns, hits a switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (subtitled KLINGON) What ship is that? Over... An interminable pause. Now a SECOND KLINGON sits next to the first. What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (subtitled KLINGON) We art thy freighter... URSVA six weeks out of Kronos... Over...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (subtitled KLINGON) Whither are you bound? Over... Another LONG pause. They squint at the delay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura and company are FRANTICALLY paging through old Klingon glossaries, manuals and dictionaries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (subtitled KLINGON) We art delivering food... things and...supplies to Rura Penthe... over... Pause...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (subtitled KLINGON) Don't catch any bugs! The VOICE LAUGHS RAUCOUSLY. Spock gestures. Uhura returns the laugh...over and out. They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was that so bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 126   THE THREE COLD SUNS are setting

dialogues.speaker: VFX
dialogues.text: The Brute, Kirk and Bones stumble and crawl across the ice. They - especially Bones - are more dead than alive. As they pull themselves along, it becomes darker...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim, leave me - I'm finished...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. (off Bones' look) You see this? He displays a STAIN on the back of his ragged coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) It's the viridium patch Spock slapped on my back right before we went aboard Gorkon's ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (faint) That cunning little Vulcan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once we're beyond the shield they should be able to pick it up two sectors away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they're even looking for us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock's looking for us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the Brute points to a ridge) We're almost there. Once we're outside, we'll make camp. DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: the ridge in darkness. They arrive, exhausted. The Brute takes a stick out of its clothes, breaks it in half. It glows brightly like a neon FLARE. He tosses it in the middle of the area and it forms a kind of fire, throwing shadows all around. Otherwise it's dark. There is some HEAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you mind explaining that little trick you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a chameloid. That's why we're such good smugglers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard of chameloids - "Shapeshifters" - I thought you were mythical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give a girl a chance, Captain. The Brute smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 127   And before his eyes becomes the enticing Martia aga

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes a lot of effort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wonder. Stop me if I'm wrong but do we really have any way of knowing if this is the real you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles at Kirk) I thought I would assume a pleasing shape. (beat) We're outside the shield. Now it's your turn, Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you say so. WHAM! He slugs Martia on the jaw; she goes down, her mouth running GREEN blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't need our help getting anywhere... where did she get these convenient clothes? And don't tell me that flare is standard prison issue...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 127   Martia sits, rubbing her mouth... and CHANGING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) It's to let them know where we are. Ask her what she's getting in return... The BRUTE gets up, rubbing his bleeding mouth -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A full pardon - which doesn't cover this -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh oh - Kirk and the Brute circle each other, Kirk's chains CLANKING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An accident wasn't good enough...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good enough for one - two would look suspicious... killed while attempting escape... now that's convincing for both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 127   The fight is on. Problem is, Martia keeps changing VFXC   shapes... Kirk grabs him, holds him tight... 127   And he wriggles free as a child... tries to run off VFXD   but Bones grabs it and they fall rolling to the SNOW...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 127   it comes up an exact copy of JAMES T. KIRK!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surprise! He smashes Bones and leaps to face his double...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your friends are late...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll be here... More fighting between Kirk and "Kirk" - they clinch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe I kissed you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must have been your lifelong ambition - The fight goes on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deserted. Scotty, exhausted, is quietly having a cup  of coffee and checking off places searched on a table  map. He runs a finger around his collar. It's warm in here... Perplexed, he puts his hand over the vent. Nothing coming out. Something blocking it? Scotty commences removing the vent cover. Not easy. As he continues his efforts, he is unaware of the TWO CREWMEN we met the night of the banquet, watching. They remain concealed, pull knives... one wants to go for Scotty. The other holds him back. Scotty removes the vent cover and pulls out what's been blocking the air circulation: two violet-stained Starfleet uniforms, with names on them... Excited by his discovery, Scotty looks around, replaces the vent cover and hurries out with the uniforms.

dialogues.speaker: THRU
dialogues.text: 131   The Crewmen follow serreptitiously, CAMERA tracking after Scotty through the labyrinthine corridors...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TWO KIRKS are still slugging it out as Bones starts to come round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it about time you became something else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like it here... Gripping each other, they roll right into A LARGE AND TERRIFYING MUZZLE. A JACKAL-MASTIFF on a leash. Both Kirks spring apart. They are surrounded by a dozen FUR- GARBED KLINGON GUARDS with weapons. SEVERAL have leashed jackal- mastiffs. And the COMMANDANT, who walks forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinks fast) What took you so long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill him! He's the one!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not me, idiot - HIM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 132   The Commandant appears briefly confused, then VFXA   ZAPS the FALSE Kirk, who dies horribly, as Bones watches. Kirk sighs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) No witnesses - He aims at Kirk and Bones -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (conversational) Damned clever if you ask me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (agrees) Killed trying to escape - it's a classic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what he wanted...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? Who wants us killed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not tell you? His name is -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Klingons rake the place they were with FIRE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 133   Kirk and Bones REMATERIALIZE to where Spock VFXA   and Chekov await them, with heavy weather BLANKETS which they don gratefully. They look scarcely recognizable. Spock and Chekov are appalled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Dammit! Dammit all to Hell--! Jesus Christ, couldn't you wait two seconds before GODDAMNSONOVABITCH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 133   Chekov produces a LASER and burns thru their chains VFXB   Spock is deeply moved to see Kirk again - though K is too busy swearing as his chains are cut off to notice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was just about to explain the whole damn -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who-?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to go back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hasty)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on... They start out at speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU BACK OF A KLINGON HEAD. Klingon is SPOKEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Escaped? He's talking to the Prison Commandant onscreen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were beamed aboard a Federation starship! I could trace -  THE KLINGON hits a button and the COMMANDANT disappears. The chair swivels REVEALING CHANG. He faces the 2nd KLINGON GENERAL we met in Azetbur's office. (Sc.68)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Escaped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It does not matter. Kirk cannot know the location.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Are you sure? Are you willing to take that chance? The General hesitates; decides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helmsman, new course! Engage cloaking device.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bird of Prey wheels about, DISAPPEARING...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk, Spock et al walk briskly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Klingons have a new weapon: a Bird of Prey that can fire while cloaked. She torpedoed Gorkon's ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, that's it.. Scotty runs up, carrying the bloodstained uniforms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain - ! Mr. Spock, I've found the missing uniforms with Klingon blood on them! They belong to - They round the corner and all STOP SHORT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the TWO CREWMEN who were stalking Scotty lie dead. Bones kneels, conducting a hasty examination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) But - the uniforms - they belong to these men! (checks the names) Burke and Samno!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not any more. Phaser rifle on "Stun" - at close range.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get close enough to a man and you can kill him on "Stun" without setting off the alarm - of course you can't get rid of the body...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First rule of assassination: always kill the assassins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we're back to square one. Kirk looks at Spock meaningfully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I talk to you? As they watch, Kirk and Spock move down the corridor and confer in an undertone.

dialogues.speaker: CU SPOCK
dialogues.text: pulls back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (white) I knew it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Attention: Court Recorder to sick bay. Yeomen Burke and Samno have been shot and wish to make statements. CODE BLUE URGENT; deposition required at once for Yeomen Burke and Samno. Wounds are serious. Court Recorder to sick bay on the double.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CREW reacting ALL OVER THE SHIP... to various PA's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the lights are OUT. A FIGURE ENTERS, looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO BODIES stretched out in darkness... THE FIGURE approaches the first body; looks down. SUDDENLY the light goes on REVEALING SPOCK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't believe it was you. Saavik.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You have to shoot. Saavik reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) If you are logical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe you. Please... She produces a phaser. The other body sits up: Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd just as soon you didn't. Saavik reacts. Bones moves out of the shadows, arms folded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe the operation is over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU SPOCK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The charge is murder. WIDEN TO REVEAL Kirk, and Bones with Saavik under guard. The CREW is STUNNED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You must have cursed yourself, for having programmed our data banks, Lieutenant. Only they revealed something wrong aboard Enterprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She programmed the torpedo hits?

dialogues.speaker: 137A QUICK FLASHBACK, (TO SCENE 46)
dialogues.text: we see Saavik programming while supposedly trying to figure out who's firing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she was unable to erase them from Mr. Scott's inventory. The computers contradicted each other...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You were clever about the boots, Lieutenant - too bad you were in such a hurry you planted them on a Megazoid...

dialogues.speaker: 137C QUICK FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: Saavik jamming the boots into Dax's locker...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) But it was when you tried to persuade me the Captain was guilty that I should have understood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't prove any of this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes I can. At my trial my personal log was introduced as evidence against me.

dialogues.speaker: 137E QUICK FLASHBACK, (TO SCENE 32)
dialogues.text: Saavik waiting outside Kirk's cabin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long did you stand outside my quarters before you coughed, Lieutenant?

dialogues.speaker: 137F BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Saavik, trapped, turns to Spock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew? He says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) The whole time? Still nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I tried to tell you... you wouldn't listen. Spock is in as much pain as we will ever see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps neither of us was hearing very well that night, Lieutenant. There were things I tried to tell you too - about having faith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've betrayed the Federation - all of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think YOU'VE been doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saving Starfleet. Klingons can't be trusted, sir, you said so yourself. They killed your son. They conspired with us to assassinate their own Chancellor. You'd make peace with them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) Who is "US?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't allow Starfleet to be dismantled over some Klingon promises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starfleet will be around long enough for me to convene a Court Martial on this ship, Lieutenant. Win, lose or draw it will be on your record. Long pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Admiral Donald.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... to offer Klingons a safe haven within Federation space is suicide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From Starfleet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: General Chang -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... In space all warriors are cold warriors...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gorkon's own man??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Romulan Ambassador - Naclus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President, they ARE vulnerable.

dialogues.speaker: 137M BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Spock stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is incredible -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you all so naive? Everyone who stands to lose from Peace. Who manufactures photon torpedoes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one wants a war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who spends millions developing the new Klingon cloaking device? (furious) The universe was a well-ordered place!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all knew our roles! Why change them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you telling us Klingons and Federation members are conspiring

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a sick way I suppose it represents progress...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly) The peace conference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What peace conference?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Azetbur has agreed to meet the Federation at a undisclosed location to continue her father's work... the conspirators obviously intend to try again... They turn to Saavik; she stares back, composed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can send a message to Starfleet Command -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not think so. Enterprise has disobeyed orders and harbors two escaped convicts. Admiral Donald will make certain all your ship-to- shore transmissions are jammed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where IS the conference?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's only a cog in the wheel - no way she knows that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And no way you'll find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we're dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Saavik) I've been dead before. Uhura, raise Excelsior. She ought to have the co-ordinates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would they give them to us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Commander is an old friend of yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (can't resist) What was it like - being dead? Spock, lost in thought, doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Captain Sulu, USS Excelsior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sulu! INTERCUT WITH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing by, Captain Kirk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You understand that by even talking to us, you're violating regulations, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Captain - your message is breaking up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Bless you, Sulu. (aloud) Where's the peace conference? They're going to attempt another assassination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Conference is at Camp Khitomer, near the Romulan border. I'm sending the exact coordinates on a coded frequency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid we may need more than that. There's a Bird of Prey on the lookout for us. And she can fire while she's cloaked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Surely not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you. Hang on. (to Saavik) How many of those things are there? Come on, Lieutenant, you're charged with murder...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just the prototype.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting underway now. But you should know, I'm in alpha Quadrant. The chances of my reaching the conference in time are slim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When does this conference start?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: According to my information, today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Captain Sulu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't mention it, Captain Kirk. He hangs up. Finds himself facing his 1st OFFICER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You realize you've just committed treason, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (serenely) To be candid, I always hoped that if the choice ever came down to betraying my country or betraying my friend, I'd have the guts to betray my country. Warp nine, mister.

dialogues.speaker: VFX
dialogues.text: Excelsior explodes across the starfield.

dialogues.speaker: VFX
dialogues.text: From a different direction, Enterprise ditto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights are dim as Kirk knocks. He has shaved, showered and put on a fresh uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock? No answer. Kirk makes to hit the switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd prefer it dark. Fair enough. Kirk enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you dining on worms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally) You were right: it was arrogant presumption that got us into this situation. You might have died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The night is young. Anyway, it was logical. (he realizes he must feel his way) You know, you're a great one for logic. I'm a great one for (shrugs) rushing in where angels fear to tread. We're both extremists. Reality is probably somewhere in between us. Spock says nothing. Kirk runs a finger over dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) I was blind. I couldn't see past the death of my son. I couldn't trust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs) I too was blind. I knew about HER - and I did nothing. I trusted too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You couldn't have known she was listening the night I dictated that entry into my log. You were proud of her achievements as a Vulcan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was PREJUDUCED by those achievements.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (understands) Gorkon had to die before I understood how prejudiced I was... Spock looks at him for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we two have grown so old and inflexible that we have outlived our usefulness? (looks at Kirk) Would that constitute a joke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone said the difference between comic and cosmic is the letter "S." You haven't outlived your usefulness - to me. And you are not responsible just because she is also Vulcan -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I SHOULD have been -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for the actions of another. No one is responsible for any actions but his own. Human beings -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I am not human. I am only -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock, you want to know something? Spock looks at him. Kirk kneels next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Everyone's human. We're too old to play games. We're only human. He holds out his hand; after hesitating, Spock takes it, presses it to his forehead. Hard. HARDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The idyllic site of the Peace Conference. Lush GREEN. A HUGE BUILDING on the horizon from within which we can HEAR MUSIC. Outside, MASSES OF PEOPLE and FLAGS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INSIDE HUGE #1 POD DOORS OPENING, REVEALING THE COUNCIL CHAMBER. VERY LOUD MUSIC as we follow the FEDERATION DELEGATION (GREEN), lead by DONALD, into the ROOM...REVERSE ON #2 POD DOORS OPENING, AS SAREK LEADS THE VULCAN DELEGATION (YELLOW?) in as they take their places...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone at their stations. Kirk in the Captain's chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, when we get to Camp Khitomer, how will we defend ourselves? I mean, if this new Bird of Prey can fire while she is invisible...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now there's a poser. Kirk and Spock exchange looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do not think anxiety is called for. (off their looks) According to my calculations we have another five minutes and twenty-two seconds to figure something out.

dialogues.speaker: VFX
dialogues.text: Enterprise THUNDERS by at warp NINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More of the opening ceremonies. CAMERA PANS TO REVEAL POD#3 with the KLINGON DELEGATION (BROWN?), lead by their AMBASSADOR and POD #4 EARTH (GREEN) DELEGATION emerging and taking their places...the Klingon and UFP PRESIDENTS, complete with ADVISORS, RETINUIES, ENTOURAGES and ATTENDANTS. FLAGS everywhere... Among them COLONEL WORF, BRIGADIER KERLA, ADMIRAL DONALD, the MUNITIONS BUSINESSMAN and a KLINGON FACE we haven't seen before... The MUSIC THUNDERS to a halt. The place looks like the UN Security Council + the Olympics. All COLOR CODED...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madam Chancellor, members of the diplomatic corps, honored guests: the United Federation of Planets welcomes you to Camp Khitomer. Now that we are assembled, I move we conclude these ceremonies and get down to business. Madam Chancellor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agreed. APPLAUSE! During the above, we watch the expressions of the faces of the VARIOUS CONSPIRATORS - uneasy. Other FACES...which one?

dialogues.speaker: VFX
dialogues.text: SCREECHES out of WARP NINE and cruises slowly. Stalking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON the main visual display, a starfield. Kirk studies it, walks over to where Spock views his SONAR. Kirk looks over his shoulder. Spock is studying it intently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close enough to beam down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet... Section 4236...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 146   Nothing on the scanner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Section 4237... Nothing. There's a lot of tension on the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POD DOORS are closed and the delegations seated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are gathered here today in high hopes, believing that differing civilizations of good will can work together to overcome intolerance. We believe that with understanding and patience it will be possible to resolve what separates us. Let us redefine progress to mean that just because we CAN do a thing it does not necessarily follow that we MUST do that thing. APPLAUSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) We believe that the responsibility for destiny rests squarely on our own shoulders... There's that KLINGON FACE again, looking around. He's carrying some sort of SUITCASE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's here - somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But if she's cloaked...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then all we've got is a neutron radiation surge - and by the time we're close enough to record it, we're ashes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, perhaps we're going about this the wrong way; our job is to get to the conference; HER job will be to stop us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make ourselves a target? Spock looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Shields. Battle stations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reads the display) Shields up. Battle stations. They are bathed in emergency RED LIGHT. Alarms SOUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Chekov, take us forward, thrusters only, one half impulse power...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir; thrusters... It feels like walking on eggs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhura?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, Captain. If they're here, they're rigger for silent running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she fires, she has a perfectly valid excuse. We're a renegade ship coming dangerously close to two heads of state during a vital interstellar conference. Dead silence, then a CRASH OF NOISE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APPLAUSE for the President's speech! Now President Azetbur rises to make her opening remarks. The KLINGON FACE makes eye contact with ADMIRAL DONALD, who nods discreetly. The SUITCASE starts moving...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as before. CLOSE UPS of various faces, sweating... SUDDENLY AN EXPLOSION! The SHIP shudders, hit! CLAXONS!

dialogues.speaker: VFXA
dialogues.text: INT. CLOAKED BIRD OF PREY featuring the ENTERPRISE onscreen. They are rigged for silent running - no one else is making a sound. They're bridge is bathed in GREEN light... Chang stands next to the GUNNER. He points towards ENTERPRISE, nudges the man, who nods, hits controls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 152   Another torpedo sails off and explodes against the VFXB   shields of the ENTERPRISE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk and his crew grab hold of things, tight-lipped...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is fun...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, shall we attempt to return fire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At what, Mr. Chekov? WHAM! Hit again. Everyone goes flying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 153   Instinctively Kirk looks at the main display - sees VFX   nothing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty, reverse engines. All astern one half impulse power. Back off. Back off!

dialogues.speaker: VFX
dialogues.text: The battered Enterprise reverses field, backing away from nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 155   watching the maneuver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very soft) What's she doing? The HELMSMAN shrugs. Chang nudges him to follow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The empty starfield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's she waiting for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably trying to figure out why we're reversing, wondering if we detect her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 156   ON the main visual display, where everyone's attent VFX   is riveted. A flare from black space.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Incoming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "SHIELD" LIGHTS flicker as the room RECOILS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She canna take much more of this, Captain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON KIRK reacting. Don't I know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sulu, where the Hell are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXCELSIOR warping as fast as she can...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In range?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet, Captain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, come on...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll fly apart...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fly her apart, then!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... many people speculated about my father's motives. There were those who said he was an idealist, driven by visionary notions; others said he had no choice, that he was a pragmatic technocrat, making the best of a devastating situation. Great men are seldom good men. The truth is my father was both: a pragmatist and an idealist. If Praxis hadn't exploded, then quite possibly his idealism would not have found expression. Nor would mine. We are a proud race. We are here because we want to go on being proud... (grim) if we cannot make war, (smiles) we will make peace...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the SUITCASE ON THE MOVE through people listening...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 164   All watching Enterprise. Chang signals and the VFX   Torpedo OFFICER FIRES off another one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahead full impulse!

dialogues.speaker: VFX
dialogues.text: Enterprise buzzes off! The Torpedo MISSES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk smiles ruefully... score one for the home team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: reactions. Chang is startled, then smiles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After her... (beat) poor thing. Doesn't know which way to go. Shakes his head, amused...

dialogues.speaker: VFX
dialogues.text: Enterprise, SCREAMING through the VOID... followed by another SCREAMING SOUND in full pursuit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, we can't see her, but she gives off heat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not from a distance. She won't show up on ANY type of scan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad we can't SMELL her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In space, no one can hear you sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a pity Starships were never equipped with bloodhounds... WHAM! Hit again... Everybody grabs onto something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think Starfleet could have envisioned our current predicament.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should write them a letter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better post date it. WHAM!... even harder this time... Spock thinks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under impulse power she expends fuel like any other ship. We call it "Plasma" - I do not know the Klingon name for it, but by any name it is merely ionized gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what about all that atmospheric equipment we're carrying to catalogue gaseous anomalies? They look at each other like she's crazy. Then -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starts out) I'm going to perform surgery on a torpedo - you never know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (going with him) You may need assistance, doctor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he's been waiting all his life) Fascinating... They race out as the ship is HIT again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Chekov, slow down. Take us forward, thrusters only, one quarter impulse power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aye, sir; thrusters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: APPLAUSE for Azetbur's speech! Donald looks around. Sees THE FACE... nods discreetly... The UFP President applauds... he's vulnerable... the face moves OFF... CinC Starfleet rises to speak, blocking the President...

dialogues.speaker: VFX
dialogues.text: Enterprise moving slowly, alone. Beat. WHAM! Hit again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones and Spock emerge with a bulky HEAT SENSOR and run down the shaking corridors...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bet you wish you'd stood in bed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vulcans sleep lying down... For a moment Bones buys it - then, on their backs -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spock, that was actually funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We DO sleep lying down. WHAM - they almost fall over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scotty and his men have obviously felt the impact as well. Some "SHIELD" lights are blinking off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, she's packing quite a wallop. Shields weakening.

dialogues.speaker: VFX
dialogues.text: scarred, trace lines of torpedo visible. WIDEN TO REVEAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sulu, et al, watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shields up. Tell them the Cavalry's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 175A   A torpedo flashes out of nothing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 176   Chang watches it go by. Sees Excelsior as well VFX   as Enterprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So. He points to Excelsior, nudges the gunner, who fires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 177   They see Excelsior's shields take the torpedo HIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold us steady, Mr. Scott. Ready to fire... Bones...! Reactions from the battered CREW...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a hand opening a CASE: inside, the disassembled parts of a rifle PHASER with telescopic mount. We don't know where we are exactly, but we can HEAR the CONFERENCE ECHOING -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones and Spock DESCEND ON THE TORPEDO LIFT WITH A TORPEDO, frantically trying to drill a hole in its nose to accommodate an ATMOSPHERE SENSOR as the whole bay TREMBLES with the hit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones, where's my torpedo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me and my big mouth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm yourself, doctor, the operation is almost complete...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (one final twist) Thank you, nurse. Jim, she's ready! Lock and load! They jump off the lift and out of the way as the torpedo starts forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Pity they're retiring us just as I was starting to understand you, Spock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (agreeing) We WERE beginning to hit our stride together, doctor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can see the SHIELD lights dimming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frantic) Shields collapsing...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 181   Even as he speaks, the Bird of Prey, fires at VFX   Enterprise. The photon trajectory is clear

dialogues.speaker: VFX
dialogues.text: ENTERPRISE TAKES ANOTHER HIT....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO SHIELDS this time! EXPLODES! WOW. AUTOTIGHT BULKHEAD DOORS CLOSE, PROTECTING THE VESSEL FROM SPACE EXPOSURE. SMOKE, LIQUIDS SQUIRTING EVERYWHERE... Things tumbling off shelves, out of overheads...DOORS WHOOSHING CLOSED!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chang smiles; this is more like it...he can see the Enterprise is damaged...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HANDS assembling the special phaser...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire! CLOSE UP a hand pushes a button...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: another hand on a phaser trigger...

dialogues.speaker: VFX
dialogues.text: Enterprise's torpedo tracks the HEAT; it goes in a strange trajectory but then again we can't see what it's heading towards...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 189   As Chang watches in FASCINATION, the damn thing VFX   circles and heads right for them! He realizes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... "or NOT to be..."

dialogues.speaker: VFX
dialogues.text: Enterprise fires a direct hit, an the Bird of Prey is illuminated in the firelight. She spins around, trying to regain her position, DEBRIS fragmenting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aim for the center of that explosion and FIRE!

dialogues.speaker: VFX
dialogues.text: Excelsior and Enterprise, having trapped the "black hole" in a triangle between them, fire. The Bird of Prey suddenly blows apart. As she explodes she DECLOAKS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 193   Kirk et al MATERIALIZE and starts running through VFX   masses of PEOPLE who are too startled to stop them

dialogues.speaker: CU THE TRIGGER FINGER
dialogues.text: tightening as... ... KIRK fights his way to the center of the room!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. President! He flings his body on the President, pushing him out of the way, just as the phaser FIRES... Panic in the room, PEOPLE SCRAMBLING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arrest those men!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arrest yourself. He stands aside to reveal LT. SAAVIK in handcuffs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got a full confession.

dialogues.speaker: THE ASSASSIN'S NICHE
dialogues.text: he turns to run, but SCOTTY whirls and fires! As all GASP, the ASSASSIN sways, falls off the balcony, clutching his face where the PHASER HIT, and SCREAMING... The KLINGON FACE COMES MELTING OFF REVEALING the STARFLEET OFFICER who prepared OPERATION "RETRIEVE". Not a Klingon, after all. The other conspirators race for the EXIT, only to be blocked by

dialogues.speaker: SULU
dialogues.text: 196   as he MATERIALIZES, phaser in hand -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a minute. The conspirators race in another direction: they are blocked by KERLA... and Bones -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you.

dialogues.speaker: PRESIDENTIAL GUARDS MOVE IN...
dialogues.text: The UFP President stands up, stares with disbelief. So does President Azetbur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the meaning of this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about the future, Madam Chancellor. Some people think the future means the end of history. Kirk walks up to the ROMULAN AMBASSADOR, now under guard -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) But we haven't run out of history just yet. (remembers) Your father quoted Hamlet: he called the future - "the undiscovered country"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always assumed Hamlet meant death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gorkon thought the undiscovered country might mean something else - another kin of life. People can be very frightened of change. I know I was. He walks to Saavik.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) There's an old expression: it takes one to know one. When Saavik looks at Kirk there are tears in her eyes. He turns to Azetbur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've restored my father's faith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've restored my son's.

dialogues.speaker: VFX
dialogues.text: Enterprise, her hull blackened with torpedo scars, idles next to the MUCH LARGER EXCELSIOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They might as well arrest me, too; I felt like Lieutenant Saavik.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointed) But you didn't join a conspiracy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (half for Spock) They don't arrest people for having feelings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If they did we'd all have to turn ourselves in. How CAN we rely on them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at Spock) The only way to find out if a man's trustworthy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... is to trust him. A wintry smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Kirk...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirk here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) As much to the crew of the Enterprise, I owe you my thanks, Captain Sulu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to see you in action one more time, Captain Kirk. Take care.

dialogues.speaker: VFX
dialogues.text: Excelsior gets underway with a roar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: all watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By God, that's a big ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so big as her Captain, I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time we got underway ourselves, gentlemen. (stretches) Once again, we've saved civilization as we know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the good news is they're not going to prosecute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs) To be -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or not to be -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the question -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Course heading, Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Second star to the right - and straight on till morning...

dialogues.speaker: VFXA
dialogues.text: The battered Enterprise makes way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain's log, U.S.S. Enterprise, Stardate 8769.24. This is the final cruise of the Starship Enterprise under my command. This ship and her history will shortly become the care of a new generation. To them and their posterity will we commit our future. They will continue the voyages we have begun and journey to ALL the undiscovered countries, boldly going where no man... where no ONE has gone before.
